tap.data

Class VOTableIterator

  • java.lang.Object
    • tap.data.VOTableIterator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TableIterator

    public class VOTableIterator
extends java.lang.Object
implements TableIterator

    TableIterator which lets iterate over a VOTable input stream using STIL.

    getColType() will return TAP type based on the type declared in the VOTable metadata part.

    Since:
    2.0
    Version:
    2.1 (07/2015)
    Author:
    Grégory Mantelet (ARI)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected static class  VOTableIterator.StreamVOTableSink
      This class lets consume the metadata and rows of a VOTable document.

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean endReached
      Indicate whether the last row has already been reached.
      protected int indCol
      Index of the last read column (=0 just after nextRow() and before nextCol(), =nbCol after the last column has been read).
      protected java.io.InputStream input
      Stream containing the VOTable on which this TableIterator is iterating.

      Indicate whether the row iteration has already started.
      protected int nbCol
      Number of columns available according to the metadata.
      protected java.lang.Object[] row
      The last read row.
      protected VOTableIterator.StreamVOTableSink sink
      The StarTable consumer which is used to iterate on each row.
      protected static java.lang.String STREAM_ABORTED_MESSAGE
      Message of the IOException sent when the streaming is aborted.

      • VOTableIterator

        public VOTableIterator(java.io.InputStream input)
                throws DataReadException
        Build a TableIterator able to read rows and columns inside the given VOTable input stream.
        Parameters:
        input - Input stream over a VOTable document.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If NULL is given in parameter.
        DataReadException - If the given VOTable can not be parsed.

    • Method Detail

      • getMetadata

        public TAPColumn[] getMetadata()
                        throws DataReadException
        Description copied from interface: TableIterator

        Get all the metadata column that have been successfully extracted at the creation of this iterator.

        Important: This function should be callable at any moment from the creation of the iterator until the end of the table dataset has been reached.

        Note: This function MAY BE NOT IMPLEMENTED or the metadata can not be fetched. In this case, NULL will be returned.

        Warning: If the metadata part of the original document is corrupted (i.e. false number of columns), the column type information should be fetched thanks to TableIterator.getColType() while iterating over rows and columns.

        Specified by:
        getMetadata in interface TableIterator
        Returns:
        An array of TAPColumn objects (each for a column of any row), or NULL if this function is not implemented OR if it was not possible to get these metadata.
        Throws:
        DataReadException
        See Also:
        TableIterator.getColType()

      • nextRow

        public boolean nextRow()
                throws DataReadException
        Description copied from interface: TableIterator

        Go to the next row if there is one.

        Note: After a call to this function the columns must be fetched individually using TableIterator.nextCol() IF this function returned true.

        Specified by:
        nextRow in interface TableIterator
        Returns:
        true if the next row has been successfully reached, false if no more rows can be read.
        Throws:
        DataReadException - If an error occurs while reading the table dataset.

      • hasNextCol

        public boolean hasNextCol()
                   throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                          DataReadException
        Description copied from interface: TableIterator
        Tell whether another column is available.
        Specified by:
        hasNextCol in interface TableIterator
        Returns:
        true if TableIterator.nextCol() will return the value of the next column with no error, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If TableIterator.nextRow() has not yet been called.
        DataReadException - If an error occurs while reading the table dataset.

      • nextCol

        public java.lang.Object nextCol()
                         throws java.util.NoSuchElementException,
                                java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                DataReadException
        Description copied from interface: TableIterator

        Return the value of the next column.

        Note: The column type can be fetched using TableIterator.getColType() after a call to TableIterator.nextCol().

        Specified by:
        nextCol in interface TableIterator
        Returns:
        Get the value of the next column.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - If no more column value is available.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If TableIterator.nextRow() has not yet been called.
        DataReadException - If an error occurs while reading the table dataset.

      • getColType

        public DBType getColType()
                  throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                         DataReadException
        Description copied from interface: TableIterator

        Get the type of the current column value.

        Note 1: "Current column value" means here "the value last returned by TableIterator.nextCol()".

        Note 2: This function MAY BE NOT IMPLEMENTED or the type information can not be fetched. If this is the case, NULL will be returned.

        Warning: In some cases, the metadata part of the original document does not match with the data it should have represented. In such case, the types returned here and by TableIterator.getMetadata() would be different. In case of such mismatch, the type returned by TableIterator.getColType() should be considered as more correct/accurate.

        Specified by:
        getColType in interface TableIterator
        Returns:
        Type of the current column value, or NULL if this information is not available or if this function is not implemented.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If TableIterator.nextCol() has not yet been called.
        DataReadException - If an error occurs while reading the table dataset.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws DataReadException
        Description copied from interface: TableIterator
        Close the stream or input over which this class iterates.
        Specified by:
        close in interface TableIterator
        Throws:
        DataReadException - If any error occurs while closing it.

      • checkReadState

        protected void checkReadState()
                       throws java.lang.IllegalStateException

        Check the row iteration state. That's to say whether:

        • the row iteration has started = the first row has been read = a first call of nextRow() has been done
        • AND the row iteration is not finished = the last row has been read.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • resolveVotType

        public static VotType resolveVotType(java.lang.String datatype,
                     java.lang.String arraysize,
                     java.lang.String xtype)
                              throws DataReadException
        Resolve a VOTable field type by using the datatype, arraysize and xtype strings as specified in a VOTable document.
        Parameters:
        datatype - Attribute value of VOTable corresponding to the datatype.
        arraysize - Attribute value of VOTable corresponding to the arraysize.
        xtype - Attribute value of VOTable corresponding to the xtype.
        Returns:
        The resolved VOTable field type.
        Throws:
        DataReadException - If a field datatype is unknown or missing.
